cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi SE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then turning north-northeast toward the west coast of Florida (near Tampa Bay) Wednesday into Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Central west Florida coast near/just north of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: None currently in effect for Tampa Bay; watches lie north of Anclote River and other areas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Englewood to Anclote River, including Tampa Bay (Hurricane Warning); Anclote River southward to Flamingo including Tampa Bay (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central west Florida coast from Bonita Beach northward to Suwannee River, including Tampa Bay and adjacent barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) possible by Tuesday night; hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) expected Wednesday at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 5–10 ft forecast for Tampa Bay and adjacent coast, including Port Manatee.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with local maxima up to 20 inches expected across central west Florida, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents hindering vessel movements.
